Package com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.directory

Class UserDirectory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.circa.mrv.grs_manager.directory.UserDirectory
  • public class UserDirectory
extends java.lang.Object
    The userDirectory is a list of all users.
    Author:
    Arthur Vargas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      UserDirectory()
      Constructs an empty userDirectory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean addUser​(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String email, java.lang.String hashPW)
      Adds a user to the directory.
      java.lang.String[][] getEmployeeDirectory()
      Returns all users in the directory with a column for first name, last name, and id.
      User getUserById​(java.lang.String id)
      Gets the user, specified by Id, from the directory if the user id matches one in the directory.
      LinkedAbstractList<User> getUsers()
      Returns the LinkedAbstractList of users contained in this user directory.

      Constructs the user directory by reading in user information from the given file.

      Creates an empty user directory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserDirectory

        public UserDirectory()
        Constructs an empty userDirectory

    • Method Detail

      • newUserDirectory

        public void newUserDirectory()
        Creates an empty user directory. All users in the previous list are lost unless saved by the user.

      • loadUsersFromFile

        public void loadUsersFromFile​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Constructs the user directory by reading in user information from the given file. Throws an IllegalArgumentException if the file cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file containing list of users

      • getUserById

        public User getUserById​(java.lang.String id)
        Gets the user, specified by Id, from the directory if the user id matches one in the directory.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the user to get.
        Returns:
        the user matching the id. If no match is found, null is returned.

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser​(java.lang.String firstName,
                       java.lang.String lastName,
                       java.lang.String id,
                       java.lang.String email,
                       java.lang.String hashPW)
        Adds a user to the directory. Returns true if the user is added and false if the user is unable to be added because their id matches another user id. This method also hashes the employee password for internal storage.
        Parameters:
        firstName - employee first name
        lastName - employee last name
        id - employee id
        email - employee email
        password - employee password
        repeatPassword - employee repeated password
        Returns:
        true if added

      • removeUser

        public boolean removeUser​(java.lang.String userId)
        Removes the users with the given id from the list of user with the given id. Returns true if the user is removed and false if the user is not in the list.
        Parameters:
        userId - user id
        Returns:
        true if removed

      • getEmployeeDirectory

        public java.lang.String[][] getEmployeeDirectory()
        Returns all users in the directory with a column for first name, last name, and id.
        Returns:
        String array containing user first name, last name, and id.

      • saveUserDirectory

        public void saveUserDirectory​(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves all users in the directory to a file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of file to save user to.

      • getUsers

        public LinkedAbstractList<User> getUsers()
        Returns the LinkedAbstractList of users contained in this user directory.
        Returns:
        users the directory of users
